Text:
Not watchable on anything other than a GameBoy screen.
V: 5
A: 9
At this quality, the file should be no larger than 200 MB.  Please read up on x264, which can encode a full-length movie @ 720p in under 700 MB.
x264 won't play on either of my computers, and when it does, it looks pixelated and crappy, runs slow, or just plain skips.  It's not for everyone.

@AirGold45 - unless your computer is from the 90s (in which case, get a new one!) , it should be able to play x264 without problems.  We shouldn't have to deal with crappy xvid rips just because you can't be bothered to learn how to play newer/better codecs.  Check out VLC and educate yourself.
it's pritty crappy quality when i run it in vlc here too. how can i improve the quality using codecs when i want to burn this onto a dvd?
